Description: Body sherds of black-figured North Ionian pottery plate; white slip. 781a. Top: parts of two draped figures to right preserved from shoulders to knees; unusual 'bell-corselet' treatment of drapery at waist, with broken key pattern; incised vertical zigzag on skirts of both figures; added white on left-hand figure's skirt, probably red on right-hand one); right figure holds a plectrum and a lyre (and possibly more); object held by left figure lost; underside ridged with brown bands and lines. 781b. Top: central parts of two figures to right; arm and shoulder of left figure preserved, holding right arm of second figure by the wrist; hatching on drapery; right figure is female, holding out left hand; right arm very worn; different treatment of waist from that of 781a, though same vertical wavy lines on skirt and added white. Underside ridged with banding not fully as on 781a, but consistent with it coming from other side of plate.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.1137)
